greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Compound filter: a(n) = P(A046523(n), A046523(1+n)), where P(n,k) is sequence A000027 used as a pairing function.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ This function from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 17 2011
def T(n, m): return ((n + m)**2 - n - 3*m + 2)/2
return sorted([f[i] for i in f])
def a(n): return T(a046523(n), a046523(n + 1)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 07 2017
xref: Cf. A005383 (after its initial term 3, gives the positions of 23's in this sequence).
Cf. A051950 (one of the matches not matched by A046523 alone).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 07 2017
